hints.content: Start by understanding what an arithmetic progression (AP) is. In an AP, the difference between consecutive elements is constant. For example, in the sequence [5, 7, 9], the common difference is 2.
Consider the properties of the input array. It may not be sorted, so think about how you can determine the common difference without assuming order.

To find the missing number, you first need to identify the common difference. You can do this by comparing the first few elements of the array. For instance, if you take the first two elements, you can calculate the difference.

Remember that the missing number is part of a sequence. If you can determine the expected number of elements in the AP based on the first and last elements, it can help you identify the missing element.
Think about how you can use the formula for the n-th term of an AP. If you have the first term and the common difference, you can express any term in the sequence as: `a_n = a + (n-1) * d`.
Consider iterating through the sorted version of the array. By comparing each element to the expected value based on the common difference, you can identify where the missing number should be.
What if the input array has only two elements? Make sure to handle edge cases where the length of the array is minimal, as this will affect how you calculate the missing number.
If the input array is not guaranteed to be sorted, think about how you can sort it first, or alternatively, find the minimum and maximum values to help establish the range of expected numbers.
You might want to consider using a set to keep track of the numbers you have seen. This can help you quickly check if a number you expect to see is actually present in the array.

Finally, after determining the expected number of elements and the common difference, you can loop through the expected sequence to find the missing number. Remember to return the missing number as your result.

questionNotes: The input array may not be sorted.
The length of the input array will be at least 2.
The missing number is guaranteed to exist in the sequence.
The common difference between elements is constant.
